annotation: <history><entry><input>ssh user@ubuntu-vm</input><output>Welcome to Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (Jammy)</output><annotation>Connecting to the Ubuntu 22.04 LTS virtual machine via SSH.</annotation></entry><entry><input>df -h</input><output>Filesystem      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on /dev/sda1       50G  4.0G   43G   9% / tmpfs           4.0G  2.0M  4.0G   1% /dev/shm</output><annotation>Checking the disk space usage on the system using `df -h`.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo apt update</input><output>Get:1 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy InRelease [273 kB] Fetched 273 kB in 1s (380 kB/s) Reading package lists... Done</output><annotation>Updating the package lists with `sudo apt update`.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo apt install -y vim</input><output>Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree Reading state information... Done The following additional packages will be installed: vim-common xxd</output><annotation>Installing `vim`, a text editor for the system.</annotation></entry><entry><input>vim --version</input><output>VIM - Vi IMproved 8.2 (2019 Dec 12, compiled Aug 28 2024 12:10:23) Included patches: 1-999</output><annotation>Checking the installed version of `vim` to confirm installation.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo apt install -y python3-pip</input><output>Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree Reading state information... Done The following additional packages will be installed: python3-setuptools python3-wheel</output><annotation>Installing `python3-pip` to manage Python packages.</annotation></entry><entry><input>pip3 --version</input><output>pip 22.3.1 from /usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pip (python 3.10)</output><annotation>Verifying the installation of `pip3` by checking its version.</annotation></entry><entry><input>wget https://www.example.com</input><output>wget: unable to resolve host address 'www.example.com'</output><annotation>Attempting to fetch a webpage using `wget` but encountering a DNS resolution issue.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo systemctl restart systemd-resolved</input><output></output><annotation>Restarting the DNS resolver service to resolve the DNS issue.</annotation></entry><entry><input>wget https://www.example.com</input><output>--2024-11-15 13:00:00--  https://www.example.com/ Resolving www.example.com (www.example.com)... 93.184.216.34, 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334 Connecting to www.example.com (www.example.com)|93.184.216.34|:443... connected. HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK Length: 1256 (1.2K) [text/html]</output><annotation>Successfully fetching the webpage using `wget` after restarting the DNS service.</annotation></entry><entry><input>exit</input><output></output><annotation>Exiting the SSH session after completing the tasks.</annotation></entry></history>
